rows.text:
* Discuss with your partner and other members of the family the importance of close family relationships.
* Practice interaction activities that improve family relationships by living like you have only 3 months to live with your children and spouse during the week.
rows.title: Practice activity

rows.text:
* Try out four parenting practices that can help your child to become the child you desire to have at 20 years.
* Discuss with your family members and draw family goals and objectives that will support you in nurturing the children.
rows.title: Practice activity

rows.text: * Take 5 minutes every day and practice interactive play with your children in any game of their choice.
rows.title: Practice activity

rows.text: * Practice any one play or fun moments from your childhood that can improve your relationship and bond with your child/children.
rows.title: Practice activity

rows.text: * Practice the parenting style that you would want to be predominant in your family during the week. Take off time and develop a family goal together with the children and other members in the household.
rows.title: Practice activity

rows.text: * Try to practice the new techniques for resolving conflict.
rows.title: Practice activity

rows.text:
* Discuss with your partner/children about the benefits and challenges of family time together
*Practice a new way or something you have not been doing for a long time to care for your child/ren to improve your relationship and bond.
rows.title: Practice activity

rows.text:
If you have a partner, this week discuss with them the goals of your marriage and how to improve marital satisfaction without resorting to blaming each other 

Try out three different things during this week to spice up your relationship.
rows.title: Practice activity

rows.text: * Find time and do something interesting with your adolescent childlren during the week. Have an open feedback session to enable you to understand your adolescent better, including  understanding things they enjoy to do and how best you can support them.
rows.title: Practice activity

rows.text: * As you end this session, if you have school going children, identify any two of their unmet school needs and attempt to fulfill them during the week as a means to encourage them to achieve at school. Those needs should not be financial in nature.
rows.title: Practice activity

rows.text: * As you end this session, reflect on the effects of the gender norms and practices that influenced your behaviour and parenting practices with your children and spouse?
rows.title: Practice activity

rows.text:
* Reflect on the positive things you remember from your adolescence stage and your relationship and communications with your parents that helped you delay sex and practice one with your children/family.

* Find ways to create open communication between you and your children so they can open up to you about their circles of friendships.
rows.title: Practice activity

rows.text: *  As you end this session, reflect on the ways in which you will share the knowledge you gained from this activity with your spouse, children, and neighbors.
rows.title: Practice activity
The Closing Activity
rows.text:
We have come to the end of the programme but there is only one more thing to be done: the award of certificates.        

As a participant who has successfully completed the programme, you will be awarded a certificate (we will send you a PDF to print either to your telephone or email)
